ground_truth: She goes back into the room and begins taking things up, flinging down men's clothes, leather trousers, a suitcase, and a teddy bear. Fergus looks to the man down in the street, a parody of rejection with his things in his arms. Dil grabs a large goldfish bowl and flings it down, which breaks to bits on the pavement, and goldfish thrash around in the street. Upstairs, Dil closes the window shut. Fergus stands as Dil hands him a glass, and he walks past the photograph and sits down. He looks from her to the picture, nods toward it, and she looks down into her drink. They fall into one another's arms, and she stretches up with her whole body over him as they grow suddenly and violently passionate, with the photograph above them seeming to smile. He draws up her dress with his hands, but she suddenly pulls away, comes up toward him once more, opens the buttons on his shirt, and her mouth travels down his chest. Fergus tries to draw her up toward him, but her hand reaches up to his mouth and presses his head back while her other hand undoes his pants, kisses his stomach, and her mouth moves down his body. Fergus stares at the picture of Jody, whose eyes seem to burn through him. Dil raises her head and kisses his mouth, with tears in his eyes. She sits in front of the mirror, and Fergus gets up, stands behind her, and gently pushes the hair from her face. She embraces him, sits back down in front of the mirror, and Fergus leaves as she reapplies her lipstick. A singer in a blue dress performs while Dil and Fergus are by the bar, both drinking drinks with umbrellas. Dave comes up behind them with his neck brace, stands, and steps two feet back, while Fergus takes Dil's arm. The woman is singing, Dil holds her cheek close to his, looks at him out of the corner of her eye, draws back, looks at him, and dances closer. In the bar, people sing along with the music as Col sings, and Dave sits at the bar sulking. She puts her cheek against his, and Dave slams his drink down, stands up to leave, and on the stage, the act finishes. Dil draws Fergus back to the bar, Col, the barman, pours her drink, and Col pours and smiles. He drinks, grimaces, she throws it back in one, takes the bottle herself, fills their glasses, slams it back, and he sips as she tilts his glass back, and he swallows it in one. She enters; Fergus walks in slowly, and he looks from the cricket whites that are hanging up behind a curtain to the photographs.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She returns back into the chamber and commences retrieving items up, hurling down men's garments, leather pants, a valise, and a teddy bear. Fergus glances to the man down in the road, a caricature of dismissal with his belongings in his arms. Dil seizes a sizable goldfish bowl and hurls it down, which shatters to fragments on the sidewalk, and goldfish thrash about in the street. Upstairs, Dil draws the window shut. Fergus stands as Dil passes him a tumbler, and he strides past the photograph and seats himself. He gazes from her to the illustration, nods toward it, and she glances down into her beverage. They fall into each other's embrace, and she stretches up with her entire body over him as they grow suddenly and violently fervent, with the picture above them seeming to grin. He draws up her gown with his hands, but she suddenly pulls away, approaches up toward him once more, unfastens the buttons on his shirt, and her lips travel down his torso. Fergus attempts to draw her up toward him, but her hand reaches up to his lips and presses his head back while her other hand undoes his trousers, kisses his abdomen, and her lips moves down his figure. Fergus stares at the illustration of Jody, whose eyes seem to burn through him. Dil raises her head and kisses his lips, with tears in his eyes. She sits in front of the mirror, and Fergus rises, stands behind her, and gently pushes the hair from her visage. She embraces him, sits back down in front of the mirror, and Fergus departs as she reapplies her lipstick. A vocalist in a blue gown performs while Dil and Fergus are by the bar, both drinking beverages with umbrellas. Dave approaches up behind them with his neck brace, stands, and steps two feet back, while Fergus grips Dil's arm. The lady is singing, Dil holds her cheek close to his, glances at him out of the corner of her eye, draws back, looks at him, and dances closer. In the bar, individuals sing along with the melody as Col sings, and Dave sits at the bar sulking. She puts her cheek against his, and Dave slams his beverage down, rises up to depart, and on the stage, the act concludes. Dil draws Fergus back to the bar, Col, the bartender, pours her beverage, and Col pours and grins. He drinks, grimaces, she throws it back in one, takes the bottle herself, fills their tumblers, slams it back, and he sips as she tilts his tumbler back, and he swallows it in one. She enters; Fergus ambles in slowly, and he gazes from the cricket whites that are hanging up behind a drape to the illustrations.

He drinks, grimaces, it is thrown back in one by her, the bottle is taken by her herself, their glasses are filled, it is slammed back by her, and he sips as his glass is tilted back by her, and it is swallowed in one by him. She enters; Fergus walks in slowly, and the cricket whites that are hanging up behind a curtain are looked at by him, along with the photographs.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She returns to the room, tossing men's clothes, leather trousers, a suitcase, and a teddy bear. Fergus watches a man in the street, a parody of rejection with his belongings. Dil throws a goldfish bowl, shattering it on the pavement, and goldfish thrash around. She shuts the window. Fergus stands as Dil hands him a glass, and he sits, glancing between her and a photograph. They embrace passionately, the photo above them seeming to smile. He lifts her dress, but she pulls away, opens his shirt, and kisses his chest. Fergus tries to pull her up, but she presses his head back, undoes his pants, kisses his stomach, and moves down his body. Fergus stares at Jody's picture, feeling its gaze. Dil kisses him, tears in his eyes. She sits at the mirror, and Fergus gently moves her hair before leaving as she reapplies lipstick. A singer in a blue dress performs while Dil and Fergus drink at the bar. Dave, in a neck brace, approaches, and Fergus takes Dil's arm. She dances closer, cheek to cheek, as people sing along. Dave slams his drink, stands to leave, and the act ends. Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours drinks. She downs hers, fills their glasses, and they drink together. Fergus enters slowly, observing cricket whites and photographs behind a curtain.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She returns to the room, tossing men's clothes, leather trousers, a suitcase, and a teddy bear. Fergus watches a man in the street, holding his belongings. Dil throws a goldfish bowl, shattering it on the pavement, and goldfish flop around. She shuts the window, hands Fergus a glass, and he sits, glancing between her and a photograph. They embrace passionately under the smiling photo. He lifts her dress, but she pulls away, unbuttons his shirt, and kisses his chest. Fergus tries to pull her up, but she presses his head back, undoes his pants, and kisses his stomach. Fergus stares at Jody's picture, feeling its gaze. Dil kisses him, tears in his eyes. She sits at the mirror, and Fergus gently moves her hair before leaving as she reapplies lipstick. A singer in blue performs while Dil and Fergus drink at the bar. Dave, in a neck brace, approaches, and Fergus takes Dil's arm. She dances closer, cheek to cheek, as Dave sulks at the bar. The act ends, and Dil leads Fergus back. Col, the barman, pours drinks, and they drink together. She enters, Fergus follows, observing cricket whites and photographs.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: She returns to the room with a determined stride and begins to pick up various items, energetically tossing aside men's clothing, including leather trousers, a suitcase, and even a teddy bear. Meanwhile, Fergus glances down at the man standing in the street below, who appears to be a comical yet tragic figure of rejection, clutching his belongings awkwardly in his arms. Dil then seizes a large goldfish bowl and hurls it down with force, causing it to shatter into countless pieces on the pavement, while the goldfish inside flop and thrash about helplessly in the street. Upstairs, Dil firmly closes the window, shutting out the scene below. Fergus stands as Dil hands him a glass, and he moves past the photograph, taking a seat. He shifts his gaze from her to the picture, nodding toward it, prompting her to look down into her drink. They embrace each other passionately, with her entire body stretching over him as they become suddenly and intensely passionate, the photograph above them seemingly smiling down on the scene. He begins to lift her dress with his hands, but she abruptly pulls away, only to approach him again, unbuttoning his shirt and letting her mouth travel down his chest. Fergus attempts to draw her back up toward him, but she places her hand on his mouth, gently pushing his head back while her other hand undoes his pants, kissing his stomach as her mouth moves further down his body. Fergus finds himself staring at the picture of Jody, whose eyes seem to pierce through him with intensity. Dil raises her head to kiss his mouth, tears glistening in his eyes. She then sits in front of the mirror, and Fergus rises, standing behind her to gently brush the hair away from her face. She embraces him warmly, then sits back down in front of the mirror as Fergus departs, leaving her to reapply her lipstick. In the bar, a singer dressed in a striking blue dress performs while Dil and Fergus stand by the bar, each holding drinks adorned with little umbrellas. Dave approaches them from behind, wearing his neck brace, and takes a step back, while Fergus takes Dil's arm. The woman continues singing, and Dil presses her cheek close to his, glancing at him from the corner of her eye before drawing back, looking at him, and dancing closer. In the lively bar, patrons sing along with the music as Col performs, and Dave sits at the bar, sulking. She rests her cheek against his, and Dave slams his drink down in frustration, standing up to leave just as the act on stage concludes. Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours her a drink, smiling as he does so. She drinks it down in one swift motion, takes the bottle herself, fills their glasses, and downs it again, while he sips cautiously until she tilts his glass back, prompting him to swallow it all at once. She enters the room, and Fergus follows slowly, his eyes moving from the cricket whites hanging behind a curtain to the photographs displayed around them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a purposeful and resolute stride, she makes her way back into the room, intent on her task. She energetically begins gathering various items, vigorously tossing aside men's clothing items, which include a pair of leather trousers, a suitcase, and even a plush teddy bear. Meanwhile, Fergus shifts his gaze downward to the man standing awkwardly in the street below. This man, clutching his belongings in his arms, cuts a figure that is both comical and tragically pitiful, embodying a sense of rejection. Dil then forcefully grabs a large, shimmering goldfish bowl and throws it down with considerable strength, causing it to shatter into a myriad of tiny pieces on the pavement, while the goldfish inside thrash and flop around helplessly in the street. Upstairs, Dil resolutely shuts the window, effectively shutting out the scene below. Fergus is standing as Dil hands him a glass, and he then moves past the photograph, taking a seat. He shifts his gaze from her, directing it toward the picture, nodding toward it, which prompts her to look down into her drink. They embrace each other passionately, with her entire body stretching over him as they both become suddenly and intensely passionate, while the photograph above them seems to smile down on the unfolding scene. He begins to lift her dress with his hands, but unexpectedly, she pulls away, only to approach him once more, unbuttoning his shirt with a deliberate touch, her mouth sensuously traveling down his chest. Fergus tries to draw her back up toward him, but she gently places her hand on his mouth, softly pushing his head back, while her other hand unfastens his pants, her kisses trailing down his stomach and moving further downward. Fergus finds himself intensely staring at the picture of Jody, whose eyes seem to pierce through him with an undeniable intensity. Dil raises her head to kiss his mouth, tears shimmering in his eyes. She then positions herself in front of the mirror, and Fergus stands behind her, gently brushing the hair away from her face. She embraces him warmly, then sits back down in front of the mirror, allowing Fergus to depart, leaving her alone to reapply her lipstick. In the bar, a captivating singer wearing a striking blue dress performs while Dil and Fergus stand nearby, each holding drinks adorned with decorative little umbrellas. Dave approaches stealthily from behind, still wearing his neck brace, and takes a cautious step back, while Fergus takes Dil's arm. The woman continues singing, and Dil presses her cheek closely against his, casting a sideways glance at him from the corner of her eye before drawing back, looking directly at him, and moving closer in the dance. In the vibrant and lively atmosphere of the bar, patrons jovially sing along with the music as Col performs, while Dave sulks at the bar. She rests her cheek gently against his, and Dave slams down his drink in frustration, standing up to leave just as the act on stage comes to a close. Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours her a drink with a smile. She downs it in one swift motion, takes the bottle herself, replenishes their glasses, and drinks it down once more, while he sips cautiously until she tilts his glass back, prompting him to swallow it all at once. She enters the room with Fergus following slowly behind her, his eyes wandering from the cricket whites hanging behind a curtain to the numerous photographs displayed around them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She reenters the room with a determined stride and begins to gather various items, each one picked up with a swift motion before being flung down with force. Men's clothes scatter across the floor, followed by the heavy thud of leather trousers, the clatter of a suitcase, and the soft landing of a teddy bear. Meanwhile, Fergus shifts his gaze to the man standing down in the street, who appears as a tragic figure of rejection, clutching his belongings awkwardly in his arms. Dil, with a decisive gesture, grabs a large goldfish bowl and hurls it out the window, watching as it shatters into countless pieces on the pavement below, leaving the goldfish to thrash helplessly in the street. Upstairs, she firmly closes the window, sealing off the outside world. Fergus rises to his feet as Dil approaches him, handing him a glass, and he moves past a photograph, taking a seat. His eyes flicker between her and the picture, and he nods toward it, prompting her to lower her gaze into her drink. In a sudden, intense moment, they fall into each other's arms, with her body stretching over him as their passion ignites violently, the photograph above them seeming to smile down on the scene. His hands move to draw up her dress, but she abruptly pulls away, only to approach him again, deftly unbuttoning his shirt as her mouth trails down his chest. Fergus attempts to pull her back up toward him, but she places a hand on his mouth, gently pressing his head back while her other hand skillfully undoes his pants, her lips brushing against his stomach as her mouth continues its journey down his body. Fergus's eyes are drawn to the picture of Jody, whose gaze seems to pierce through him. Dil lifts her head, kisses his mouth, and he feels tears welling in his eyes. She then sits in front of the mirror, and Fergus rises, positioning himself behind her to tenderly push her hair away from her face. She embraces him briefly before sitting back down, and as she begins to reapply her lipstick, Fergus quietly exits the room. Later, a singer in a blue dress captivates the audience while Dil and Fergus stand by the bar, each holding a drink adorned with a small umbrella. Dave approaches from behind, his neck brace visible, and after a moment, he steps back a couple of feet, while Fergus gently takes Dil's arm. The woman continues to sing, and Dil leans her cheek close to his, casting a sidelong glance at him before drawing back, meeting his eyes, and dancing closer. Around them, the bar patrons join in the music, singing along as Col performs, while Dave sits at the bar, sulking. Dil presses her cheek against Fergus's once more, prompting Dave to slam his drink down in frustration, stand up, and leave just as the act on stage concludes. Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours her a drink with a smile. She downs it in one swift motion, takes the bottle herself, refills their glasses, and slams hers back again, while Fergus sips his drink until she tilts his glass back, encouraging him to swallow it all at once. She enters the room, and Fergus follows slowly, his eyes wandering from the cricket whites hanging behind a curtain to the photographs that adorn the space.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She returns to the room, tossing men's clothes, leather trousers, a suitcase, and a teddy bear out the window, while Fergus observes the man below collecting his belongings. Dil throws a goldfish bowl, shattering it on the pavement, and then shuts the window. Fergus accepts a glass from Dil, glances at a photograph, and sits down. They embrace passionately beneath the smiling photograph, but she suddenly pulls away, unbuttons his shirt, and kisses down his chest. Fergus tries to draw her back, but she presses his head back, undoes his pants, and kisses his stomach, while he stares at Jody's picture. Dil kisses Fergus with tears in her eyes, then sits at the mirror as Fergus gently brushes her hair aside before leaving. Later, at a bar, they drink together while a singer performs. Dave approaches, steps back, and Fergus takes Dil's arm. As the music plays, Dil dances closer to Fergus, and Dave sulks at the bar. After the performance, Dil leads Fergus back to the bar, where Col, the barman, pours drinks. Dil downs her drink, refills their glasses, and encourages Fergus to finish his. She enters a room, and Fergus follows, noticing cricket whites and photographs hanging behind a curtain.

She sits in front of the mirror, a symbol of self-reflection, and Fergus gets up, stands behind her, and gently pushes the hair from her face. She embraces him, sits back down in front of the mirror, and Fergus leaves as she reapplies her lipstick, a ritual that can signify regaining composure. A singer in a blue dress performs, evoking a classic cabaret or jazz club atmosphere, while Dil and Fergus are by the bar, both drinking drinks with colorful umbrellas, often signifying tropical or festive cocktails. Dave comes up behind them with his neck brace, a sign of recent injury or surgery, stands, and steps two feet back, while Fergus takes Dil's arm. The woman is singing, Dil holds her cheek close to his, looks at him out of the corner of her eye, draws back, looks at him, and dances closer. Dil draws Fergus back to the bar, Col, the barman, pours her drink, and Col pours and smiles, indicating familiarity or an ongoing rapport. He drinks, grimaces, as strong spirits often provoke, she throws it back in one, takes the bottle herself, fills their glasses, slams it back, and he sips as she tilts his glass back, and he swallows it in one. She enters; Fergus walks in slowly, and he looks from the cricket whites, traditionally worn for the genteel sport of cricket, symbolizing a connection to a past or different cultural aspect, that are hanging up behind a curtain to the photographs, which may chronicle personal or shared history.

The bird puts her cheek against his, and the mouse slams his drink down, stands up to leave, and on the stage, the act finishes. test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She goes back into the attic and begins taking things up, flinging down men's shoes, silk scarves, a rucksack, and a porcelain doll. Fergus looks to the man down in the alley, a parody of rejection with his things in his arms. Dil grabs a large glass jar and flings it down, which breaks to bits on the sidewalk, and marbles scatter around in the lane. Upstairs, Dil closes the balcony door shut. Fergus stands as Dil hands him a mug, and he walks past the painting and sits down. He looks from her to the canvas, nods toward it, and she looks down into her coffee. They fall into one another's arms, and she stretches up with her whole body over him as they grow suddenly and violently passionate, with the painting above them seeming to smile. He draws up her skirt with his hands, but she suddenly pulls away, comes up toward him once more, opens the buttons on his vest, and her lips travel down his chest. Fergus tries to draw her up toward him, but her hand reaches up to his mouth and presses his head back while her other hand undoes his trousers, kisses his stomach, and her lips move down his body. Fergus stares at the painting of Jody, whose eyes seem to burn through him. Dil raises her head and kisses his mouth, with tears in his eyes. She sits in front of the dresser, and Fergus gets up, stands behind her, and gently pushes the hair from her face. She embraces him, sits back down in front of the dresser, and Fergus leaves as she reapplies her mascara. A pianist in a red dress performs while Dil and Fergus are by the booth, both drinking cocktails with cherries. Dave comes up behind them with his arm sling, stands, and steps two feet back, while Fergus takes Dil's hand. The musician is playing, Dil holds her cheek close to his, looks at him out of the corner of her eye, draws back, looks at him, and dances closer. In the booth, people sway along with the melody as Col sings, and Dave sits at the counter sulking. She puts her cheek against his, and Dave slams his beer down, stands up to leave, and on the platform, the act finishes. Dil draws Fergus back to the booth, Col, the mixologist, pours her cocktail, and Col pours and smiles. He drinks, grimaces, she throws it back in one, takes the decanter herself, fills their goblets, slams it back, and he sips as she tilts his goblet back, and he swallows it in one. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She skips back into the room and starts arranging things up, tossing around men's clothes, leather trousers, a suitcase, and a teddy bear. Fergus glances at the man across the street, a parody of indifference with his things in his arms. Dil snatches a large goldfish bowl and tosses it out, which shatters to bits on the pavement, and goldfish flop around in the street. Upstairs, Dil throws the window shut. Fergus waits as Dil hands him a glass, and he strolls past the photograph and lies down. He glances from her to the picture, gestures toward it, and she peers down into her drink. They collapse into one another's arms, and she leans up with her whole body over him as they grow suddenly and calmly enamored, with the photograph above them appearing to grin. He tugs up her dress with his hands, but she suddenly steps away, drifts up toward him once more, fastens the buttons on his shirt, and her mouth journeys down his chest. Fergus attempts to pull her up toward him, but her hand slides up to his mouth and tilts his head back while her other hand fastens his pants, taps his stomach, and her mouth glides down his body. Fergus gazes at the picture of Jody, whose eyes seem to chill through him. Dil lifts her head and kisses his nose, with tears in his eyes. She settles in front of the mirror, and Fergus stands up, positions himself behind her, and carefully brushes the hair from her face. She hugs him, reclines in front of the mirror, and Fergus exits as she applies her lipstick again. A singer in a blue dress dances while Dil and Fergus are by the bar, both sipping drinks with umbrellas. Dave comes up beside them with his neck brace, sits, and leans two feet forward, while Fergus taps Dil's arm. The woman is dancing, Dil presses her cheek close to his, glances at him out of the corner of her eye, draws back, looks at him, and shuffles closer. In the bar, people clap along with the music as Col claps, and Dave stands at the bar pouting. She slides her cheek against his, and Dave slams his drink down, jumps up to leave, and on the stage, the act pauses. Dil pulls Fergus back to the bar, Col, the barman, mixes her drink, and Col mixes and frowns. He drinks, smiles, she downs it in one, grabs the bottle herself, fills their glasses, downs it again, and he pauses as she lifts his glass back, and he sips it in one. She exits; Fergus walks out slowly, and he scans from the cricket whites that are hanging up behind a curtain to the photographs.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The mailbox goes back into the garden and begins picking apples up, flinging down children's books, rubber sandals, a backpack, and a stuffed rabbit. The umbrella looks to the cat down in the ocean, a parody of confusion with its apples in its arms. The shoelace grabs a large cookie jar and flings it down, which breaks to bits on the carpet, and cookies scatter around in the ocean. Upstairs, the shoelace closes the curtain shut. The umbrella stands as the shoelace hands it a book, and it walks past the painting and sits down. It looks from the mailbox to the sculpture, nods toward it, and the mailbox looks down into its juice. They fall into one another's books, and the mailbox stretches up with its whole body over it as they grow suddenly and violently enthusiastic, with the sculpture above them seeming to grin. It draws up the mailbox's apron with its fingers, but the mailbox suddenly pulls away, comes up toward it once more, opens the pockets on its jacket, and the mailbox's spoon travels down its spine. The umbrella tries to draw the mailbox up toward it, but the mailbox's paw reaches up to its beak and presses its head back while the mailbox's other paw undoes its belt, kisses its elbow, and the mailbox's spoon moves down its shell. The umbrella stares at the painting of the kite, whose wings seem to burn through it. The shoelace raises its hat and kisses its beak, with feathers in its eyes. The mailbox sits in front of the painting, and the umbrella gets up, stands behind it, and gently pushes the ribbon from its face. The mailbox embraces it, sits back down in front of the painting, and the umbrella leaves as the mailbox reapplies its paint. A violinist in a red hat performs while the shoelace and the umbrella are by the tent, both drinking smoothies with straws. The pencil comes up behind them with its wristwatch, stands, and steps two inches back, while the umbrella takes the shoelace's ankle. The turtle is singing, the shoelace holds its toe close to it, looks at it out of the corner of its knee, draws back, looks at it, and dances closer. In the tent, animals hum along with the melody as the kite sings, and the pencil sits at the tent sulking. The mailbox puts its toe against it, and the pencil slams its smoothie down, stands up to leave, and on the stage, the melody finishes. The shoelace draws the umbrella back to the tent, the kite, the gardener, pours its smoothie, and the kite pours and grins. It drinks, grimaces, the shoelace throws it back in one, takes the jar itself, fills their cups, slams it back, and it sips as the shoelace tilts its cup back, and it swallows it in one. The shoelace enters; the umbrella walks in slowly, and it looks from the soccer balls that are hanging up behind a bookshelf to the sculptures.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat scampers back into the forest and starts lifting things up, tossing aside women's shoes, silk scarves, a backpack, and a toy robot. Brian glances at the child up in the tree, a caricature of acceptance with his belongings in his arms. Sam snatches a large watermelon and tosses it up, which shatters into pieces on the roof, and watermelon seeds scatter across the tiles. Inside, Sam pushes the closet open. Brian sits as Sam hands him a book, and he strides past the painting and reclines. He glances from him to the artwork, gestures toward it, and he gazes up into his book. They collapse into one another's embrace, and he arches down with his whole body under him as they become suddenly and delightfully merry, with the painting above them appearing to frown. He lifts up his coat with his arms, but he unexpectedly steps away, glides away from him once more, fastens the necklace on his neck, and his lips wander up his ear. Brian attempts to lift him closer, but his leg swings up to his ear and pushes his head forward while his other foot loosens his shoes, kisses his ankle, and his lips travel up his arm. Brian observes the sketch of Jamie, whose eyes seem to pierce through him. Sam lowers his hand and kisses his forehead, with laughter in his voice. He kneels in front of the fireplace, and Brian rises, stands beside him, and carefully lifts the book from his lap. He hugs him, kneels back down in front of the fireplace, and Brian exits as he admires his reflection. A dancer in a red coat performs while Sam and Brian are at the table, both sipping drinks with straws. Alex approaches from the side with his eye patch, sits, and hops one step forward, while Brian clasps Sam's shoulder. The man is humming, Sam presses his nose close to his, gazes at him out of the side of his eye, pulls away, gazes at him, and skips nearer. In the club, patrons clap along with the rhythm as Pat hums, and Alex sits at the table brooding. He places his nose against his, and Alex drops his drink up, sits down to stay, and on the stage, the show concludes. Sam draws Brian up to the table, Pat, the server, fills his plate, and Pat nods and waves. He eats, smirks, he throws it back in chunks, takes the fork himself, fills their plates, devours it, and he nibbles as he tips his plate back, and he licks it clean. He exits; Brian strolls out swiftly, and he glances from the running shoes that are dangling up beside a window to the sculptures.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: She reenters the kitchen and starts picking items up, scattering around women's jewelry, silk scarves, a backpack, and a porcelain doll. Fergus glances at the woman across the hallway, a comedy of acceptance with her belongings in her hands. Dil picks up a large flower pot and tosses it out, which shatters to pieces on the sidewalk, and daisies dance around in the breeze. Upstairs, Dil shuts the door closed. Fergus rises as Dil offers him a mug, and he strolls past the painting and reclines. He gazes from her to the artwork, gestures toward it, and she glances down into her tea. They embrace each other closely, and she stretches her whole body alongside him as they become suddenly and fiercely tender, with the painting above them appearing to wink. He lifts her blouse with his fingers, but she abruptly retreats, moves toward him once more, undoes the buttons on his jacket, and her lips travel across his shoulder. Fergus attempts to lift her toward him, but her hand reaches up to his lips and pushes his head downward while her other hand unzips his boots, kisses his thigh, and her lips glide down his body. Fergus gazes at the portrait of Jody, whose eyes seem to pierce through him. Dil raises her head and kisses his lips, with tears in his eyes. She sits before the vanity, and Fergus rises, stands beside her, and gently brushes the dust from her face. She hugs him, sits back down at the vanity, and Fergus exits as she redoes her mascara. A guitarist in a red jacket strums while Dil and Fergus are by the couch, both sipping smoothies with straws. Dave approaches behind them with his walking stick, stands, and shifts three steps sideways, while Fergus holds Dil's hand. The musician is playing, Dil rests her cheek near his, glances at him out of the corner of her eye, leans back, observes him, and sways closer. In the lounge, guests clap along with the rhythm as Col harmonizes, and Dave lounges on the sofa brooding. She leans her cheek against his, and Dave drops his sandwich, rises to depart, and on stage, the performance concludes. Dil leads Fergus back to the couch, Col, the pianist, hands her a beverage, and Col serves and chuckles. He sips, grimaces, she gulps it in one, grabs the jug herself, refills their cups, gulps it quickly, and he drinks as she tilts his cup back, and he gulps it in one. She steps in; Fergus strolls in leisurely, and he gazes from the tennis rackets that are hanging up behind a curtain to the paintings.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She tiptoes into the closet and starts piling objects down, tossing aside women's shoes, denim jackets, a backpack, and a rubber duck. Oliver glances at the child up in the attic, a mirror of acceptance with their toys in a basket. Rory picks up a tiny snow globe and tosses it up, which shatters to pieces on the rooftop, and snowflakes drift along in the attic. Downstairs, Rory swings the door wide. Oliver kneels as Rory offers him a notebook, and he strolls past the painting and stands up. He glances from him to the image, bows towards it, and he gazes down into his book. They tumble onto a pile of pillows, and he stretches down with his entire arm under him as they grow abruptly and silently contemplative, with the painting beside them seeming to weep. He pulls down her scarf with his fingers, but he promptly pushes away, drifts down from him once again, fastens the zippers on her jacket, and his gaze wanders up her sleeve. Oliver attempts to pull her down toward him, but her foot reaches down to his knee and nudges his leg forward while her other foot ties his shoelaces, taps his shoulder, and her eyes glance down his face. Oliver glares at the sculpture of Max, whose mouth seems to whisper to him. Rory lowers his arm and pats his shoulder, with laughter in their eyes. He stands beside the bookshelf, and Oliver rises, strolls beside him, and gently lifts the cap from their head. He spins him, stands up beside the bookshelf, and Oliver vanishes as he closes his notebook. A dancer in a red hat twirls while Rory and Oliver are on the patio, both sipping oranges through straws. Hank emerges next to them with his wristwatch, kneels, and jumps three feet forward, while Oliver takes Rory's hand. The musician is dancing, Rory places his foot close to hers, watches him from the edge of her view, slides forward, glances at him, and skips closer. In the club, people dance along with the rhythm as Ken dances, and Hank lounges at the table smiling. He places his hand against hers, and Hank drops his orange, kneels down to relax, and off the stage, the set concludes. Rory pulls Oliver forward to the patio, Ken, the server, offers her a cocktail, and Ken toasts and winks. He eats, smirks, she gulps it quickly, grabs the pitcher herself, pours their refills, gulps it back, and he nibbles as she angles his plate down, and he devours it quickly. He exits; Oliver strolls out hurriedly, and he glances from the guitar strings that are resting up behind a window to the murals.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Dil returns to a room, throwing men's clothes and belongings, including a teddy bear, onto the street in a parody of rejection. She breaks a goldfish bowl, leaving fish thrashing on the pavement below. After closing the window, Dil gives Fergus a drink, and they embrace passionately under the watchful eyes of a photograph. As their intimacy intensifies, Fergus is distracted by the picture of Jody, which seems to haunt him. Dil, with tears, kisses Fergus before sitting at a mirror, reapplying lipstick as Fergus exits. Later, at the bar, they share drinks with umbrellas while a singer in a blue dress performs. Dave, wearing a neck brace, approaches but retreats as Dil and Fergus continue their intimate dance. As the music plays, people sing along, but tension rises when Dave leaves after slamming his drink down. Dil and Fergus return to the bar, where Col, the bartender, serves drinks. She drinks boldly, coaxing Fergus to follow suit. Finally, Fergus enters another room, observing cricket whites and photographs, contemplating his surroundings.

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: A singer in a blue dress performs while Dil and Fergus are by the bar both drinking drinks with umbrellas  Dave comes up behind them with his neck brace stands and steps two feet back while Fergus takes Dil's arm  The woman is singing  Dil holds her cheek close to his looks at him out of the corner of her eye draws back looks at him and dances closer  In the bar people sing along with the music as Col sings and Dave sits at the bar sulking  She puts her cheek against his and Dave slams his drink down stands up to leave and on the stage the act finishes  Dil draws Fergus back to the bar  Col the barman pours her drink and Col pours and smiles  He drinks grimaces she throws it back in  one takes the bottle herself fills their glasses slams it back and he sips as she tilts his glass back and he swallows it in one  She enters  Fergus walks in slowly and he looks from the cricket whites that are hanging up behind a curtain to the photographs She goes back into the room and begins taking things up flinging down men's clothes leather trousers a suitcase and a teddy bear  Fergus looks to the man down in the street a parody of rejection with his things in his arms  Dil grabs a large goldfish bowl and flings it down which breaks to bits on the pavement and goldfish thrash around in the street  Upstairs Dil closes the window shut  Fergus stands as Dil hands him a glass and he walks past the photograph and sits down  He looks from her to the picture nods toward it and she looks down into her drink  They fall into one another's arms and she stretches up with her whole body over him as they grow suddenly and violently passionate with the photograph above them seeming to smile  He draws up her dress with his hands but she suddenly pulls away comes up toward him once more opens the buttons on his shirt and her mouth travels down his chest  Fergus tries to draw her up toward him but her hand reaches up to his mouth and presses his head back while her other hand undoes his pants kisses his stomach and her mouth moves down his body  Fergus stares at the picture of Jody whose eyes seem to burn through him  Dil raises her head and kisses his mouth with tears in his eyes  She sits in front of the mirror and Fergus gets up stands behind her and gently pushes the hair from her face  She embraces him sits back down in front of the mirror and Fergus leaves as she reapplies her lipstick
